channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Photos: See what happened at the Olympic closing ceremony
item.description: The Games in Paris wrapped up with the closing ceremony. We take a look at the lavish celebration.
item.content:encoded:
The Games in Paris wrapped up with the closing ceremony. We take a look at the lavish celebration.

(Image credit: Michael Reaves)
item.dc:creator: NPR Staff

item.title: Vance and Walz both claim the Midwest. What does it mean to be Midwestern?
item.description: While vice presidential candidates tout their Midwestern roots Ayesha talks to author Jon Lauck about what's Midwestern.
item.content:encoded: While vice presidential candidates tout their Midwestern roots Ayesha talks to author Jon Lauck about what's Midwestern.
item.dc:creator: Ayesha Rascoe

item.title: 'Like something out of a horror movie': Scientists tackle invasive sea lampreys in the Great Lakes
item.description: Invasive sea lamprey populations spiked in the Great Lakes during the pandemic. But scientists are finding new ways to keep their numbers in check.
item.content:encoded: Invasive sea lamprey populations spiked in the Great Lakes during the pandemic. But scientists are finding new ways to keep their numbers in check.

item.title: The Paris Olympics are wrapping up. How did Team USA do?
item.description: The Paris Summer Olympics wrap-up Sunday after two-and-a-half weeks of dramatic sports achievements and a bit of controversy. The United States won the most medals as it prepares to host the next Summer Games.
item.content:encoded: The Paris Summer Olympics wrap-up Sunday after two-and-a-half weeks of dramatic sports achievements and a bit of controversy. The United States won the most medals as it prepares to host the next Summer Games.
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: More than a dozen books are removed from schools statewide in Utah
item.description: Public school libraries all across Utah will look a little different once classes start this year because the state has required the schools to remove 13 book titles from their shelves permanently.
item.content:encoded: Public school libraries all across Utah will look a little different once classes start this year because the state has required the schools to remove 13 book titles from their shelves permanently.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Limbong

item.title: How are colleges confronting overdose risks?
item.description: Drug overdose is the top killer of young adults — and is a problem on college campuses, too, though it often goes unreported. One mother wants to make sure narcan is easy to get in college dorms.
item.content:encoded: Drug overdose is the top killer of young adults — and is a problem on college campuses, too, though it often goes unreported. One mother wants to make sure narcan is easy to get in college dorms.

item.title: End of the road trip for Harris
item.description: We review Vice President Kamala Harris's swing state road trip and look ahead to what's next in the Harris campaign.
item.content:encoded: We review Vice President Kamala Harris's swing state road trip and look ahead to what's next in the Harris campaign.
item.dc:creator: Deepa Shivaram

item.title: The final Olympic medal tally puts the U.S. on top in Paris
item.description: The fight for national bragging rights over gold medals — considered by many countries to be the most coveted prize — came down to the wire and, in the end, China and the U.S. tied with 40 apiece.
item.content:encoded:
The fight for national bragging rights over gold medals — considered by many countries to be the most coveted prize — came down to the wire and, in the end, China and the U.S. tied with 40 apiece.

(Image credit: Quinn Rooney)
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: Ukrainian and Russian troops are gearing up for a showdown in western Russia
item.description: After several days of rapid advances in western Russia, the Ukrainian military offensive has slowed. Russia is sending reinforcements to the area, but has not yet launched a major counterattack.
item.content:encoded:
After several days of rapid advances in western Russia, the Ukrainian military offensive has slowed. Russia is sending reinforcements to the area, but has not yet launched a major counterattack.

(Image credit: Roman Pilipey)
item.dc:creator: Greg Myre

item.title: A musical and stunt-filled closing ceremony draws the curtain on the Paris Olympics
item.description: The ceremony capped over two weeks of competition and saw Paris hand over the Olympic flag to Los Angeles, the 2028 host city.
item.content:encoded:
The ceremony capped over two weeks of competition and saw Paris hand over the Olympic flag to Los Angeles, the 2028 host city.

(Image credit: Luke Hales)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman
